data.title: Victory Venkatesh : A Star Who Shines On Everyones Face
data.meta_description: Venkatesh: Victory Venkatesh : A Star Who Shines On Everyones Face
data.text:
Venkatesh Daggubati aka Victory Venkatesh is everyone's favourite. He is one of those rarest rare stars who is adorned by everyone irrespective of other hero's fans and various sections of audience. Though Venkatesh is the elder son of Legendary Producer D Rama Naidu, he laid path on his own and grew as a crowd's most favourite hero. He had an easy way to enter films but carved a niche for himself and becoming dearer to the audience is something most can't achieve.

Venkatesh made his acting debut as a Hero with Kaliyuga Pandavulu in 1986. Then he tried hard to create a space for himself among young heroes with Chiranjeevi, Balakrishna and Nagarjuna as his contemporaries at that time. Though he has tried and scored Superhits in numerous genres like Srinivasa Kalyanam, Brahma Puthrudu, Swarna Kamalam, Prema, Ontari Poratam, Two Town Rowdy, Bobbili Raja, Coolie No 1. Major breakthrough in his career came with Chanti. The Industry Hit film has changed the course of his career.

Advertisement

Chanti brings him closer to the family audience and showed him the way in which he excelled in the future. Venkatesh filled the space of Family hero while every other hero tries to win masses. He got more and more closer to families and female audiences with his ever lovable roles and performances. Films like Sundarakanda, Abbayigaru, Intlo Illalu Vantintlo Priyuralu, Pavitra Bandham, Pellichesukundam, Surya Vamsam, Raja made him a household name in Telugu films.

Venkatesh enjoyed fan following among female audiences like no other. In many instances, apart from fans his films on the first day first show were occupied with lady audience. He earned so much confidence and respect among the family audience that most of his films witnessed long run which is a benchmark for any film' success.

Venkatesh is also an intense and powerful performer. His performances in Shatruvu, Dharma Chakram, Ganesh stands as a testament about how good he is as an actor. He is also a perfect fit for love stories. His Preminchukundam Raa, Premante Idera, Nuvvu Naku Nachav, Malliswari are memorable outings in that genre. He won prestigious Nandi Award as a best actor for six times.

He didn't shy away in sharing screen space with younger lot. Infact he is the reason behind the multi-starrer films have become a trend after so many years in Tollywood. His Seethamma Vaakitlo Sirimalle Chettu with Mahesh Babu laid path to multi starrer films. Venkatesh is known for his hilarious timing in comedy entertainers. This generation got a taste of his performances with impressive Narappa and entertaining with F2 & F3. He has also forayed into OTT with Rana Naidu in Netflix costarring with Rana Daggubati. Now, he is gearing up once again in a ferocious role with Saindhav which is gearing to release for Sankranthi.
